name: Premier Inn London Hampstead

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good sized clean room, good location close to Belsize Park Tube.
reviews.title: Good value, good location.

reviews.text: Friendly staff
reviews.title: Wonderful stay though a little out of the way

reviews.text: I stay at this hotel for 6 nights so I got quite a good impression of it.
reviews.title: Great weekend

reviews.text: The staff at the reception were very helpful and quick in arranging anything we needed and getting us a refund we required for something we got.
reviews.title: Friendly, perfectly situated great value for central London

reviews.text: The rooms are wonderful, spacious, clean and organized. Everything you need you have in the room.
reviews.title: Does what it says on the tin!

reviews.text: Premier Inn Hampstead is located in one of the nicest places to be in London. Walking distance from Hampstead village , Hampstead Heath . Kenwood House Rembrants a small journey away. Plenty of transportation to Central London.
reviews.title: warning
Consistent Quality
reviews.text: Paid parking (14 pounds a day), paid internet (about 10 pounds a day and slow)
Rooms are ok, try to stay on the back of the hotel, it is quieter. There is air conditioning, a rare goodie in cheaper London hotels.
reviews.title: Very good value for money!

reviews.text: The rates are reasonable for London (140 pounds weekdays, less on Saturday and Sunday), but if you add parking and internet they start to be on the high side.
reviews.title: Exceeded Expectations

reviews.text: WARNING - the hotel is refurbishing its rooms. This is not mentioned in their online booking site nor anywhere else- so beware, there is noise during working hours.
reviews.title: Excellent family hotel - great location

reviews.text: Can't be faulted for the price. Friendly staff, clean rooms, excellent breakfast. Perfect example of how to run a budget hotel.
reviews.title: Unbeatable stay for the price.

reviews.text: I have never come across such a disgusting hotel . we went to our room before we checked in. the room was disgusting somebody had got sick beside the bed and it smelled . then there was shake and vac on the carpet to stop the smell. so we refused to stay at the hotel. Iam very glad i didnt have my money paid. and staff were not helpful. So my advice is never stay at a 3 star budget hotel.
reviews.title: I would never recommend this hotel to anybody

reviews.text: we were pleasantly suprised by the level of service that we received from check in to check out. We would definitely use this hotel again quiet location comfortable room and an excellent selection of breakfast items.
reviews.title: good location good service would visit again

reviews.text: Nice hotel, friendly staff, rooms good size and well furnished, very clean and comfortable. Excellent value, £49 per room booked couple of weeks in advance, parking on site £14 a day which is ok for London. 5 mins walk to Belsize Park tube, plenty of places to eat and drink near by, Chez Bob on Haverstock Hill does 2 for 1 brunch from 10-12 weekdays which works out lot less expensive than hotel breakfast.
reviews.title: Comfortable, Convienient and Affordable

reviews.text: Stayed at Premier Inn London Hampstead and it was great friendly staff - really clean rooms and the food in the restaurant was exquisite.
reviews.title: PREMIER INN HAMPSTEAD - GREAT !!!

reviews.text: As you would expect from a premier inn, but room 220 was too hot, cooling only blew hot air so windows had to be left open. The room overlooked the noisy BP station so be aware and ask for an odd numbered room to overlook car park. Parking £14 overnight but can park on street after 6.30pm to 8.30am weekdays and after 1.30pm on weekends.
reviews.title: Nice location, typical premier inn, room too hot

reviews.text: Loction good for Belsize tube on Northern line, only 3 mins walk.
reviews.title: Perfect Location for the London Business Traveller for Parking and Tube links

reviews.text: Taverstock Hill has good selection of eateries, the CHinese andTapas bar were very good.
reviews.title: What a fantastic hotel!

reviews.text: Breakfast was £8.25 all you could eat, didn't try this plus Internet is £10 per 24 hours
reviews.title: OK, some issues, hopefully getting sorted. Good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have always found this hotel great for business, I hate traveling across London by car. You can park your car at the hotel for just £14.00 per night which is not that cheap but compared with Central London prices of around £40 + per day it is very reasonable. Tube station - Belsize Park very close distance away by foot and you can access all areas of London by tube from there.
reviews.title: Excellent location for a London holiday

aka: Premier Inn London Hampstead Hotel London
description: Located close to Hampstead Village, Hampstead Heath, the Kenwood House and Camden Town. Ideally situated for a wide variety of restaurants, with bars and boutique stores close by. Within easy reach of M1 and Belsize Park tube station just a 2 minute walk away. Our London Hampstead Premier Inn has everything you'd expect, incredibly comfy beds in every room and an onsite restaurant called Thyme.
